content.question: For which of the following reasons was Pliny’s fear of being tried by Domitian likely justified?

choices.label: Domitian had executed numerous senators after such trials.
Trials involving senators were often very long and expensive.
Losing the trial could have resulted in Pliny being enslaved.
Domitian used these trials to steal senators’ clients from them.

content.answer: Domitian had executed numerous senators after such trials.
